etymology.description: Pictogram of filled container (original form of 賜(賜) (cì, "bestow")) -> borrowed phonetically for "easy"
etymology.interpretation: The character 易(易) (yì, "easy") originally depicted a filled container, which is the form of 賜(賜) (cì, "bestow"). It was phonetically borrowed to express the concept of 'easy' due to its sound similarity.

examples.chinese: 他觉得这道题很易(他覺得這道題很易)。
examples.pinyin: Tā juéde zhè dào tí hěn yì.
examples.english: He thinks this problem is very easy.

examples.chinese: 他以旧易新(他以舊易新)。
examples.english: He replaces the old with the new.
